assessments.issue: False positive markdown detection - list pattern matches plain text starting with dashes
assessments.action: Refactored _has_markdown_patterns() to require at least 2 different pattern types to be detected before considering content as markdown. Also added requirement for at least 2 list items before counting lists as a pattern. This prevents false positives from plain text that happens to contain a single dash or asterisk.

assessments.issue: Line breaks lost during text extraction with soup.get_text()
assessments.action: Added separator='\n' parameter to soup.get_text() calls in both is_markdown_content() and process_description_html() functions to preserve line breaks between elements.
Removed the unused patterns list variable as part of the refactoring. The code now uses individual pattern checks with a found_patterns set to track which pattern types are detected.
Deleted revision_response.json from the repository root.

summary: Fixed all 4 issues: (1) Refactored markdown detection to require at least 2 different pattern types, preventing false positives from single dashes/asterisks in plain text; (2) Added separator='\n' to get_text() calls to preserve line breaks; (3) Removed dead code (unused patterns list) as part of the refactoring; (4) Deleted the development file revision_response.json.
